channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2023090079
item.description:
Report E-2023090079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of NA1760 was crushed during a load shift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew overpacked the one (1) damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. All NA1760-impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090004
item.description:
Report E-2023090004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN3105 Norox MCP-75 Red release from a 5-gallon jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting an 8’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below due to the pail being crushed as a result of stacking. Oil dri was deployed onto the impacted areas and worked into to clean and remove all free-standing liquid. The damaged empty jug, absorbents, PPE, and spill pads were then collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. An impacted pallet was also cut up and placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. Both drums were submerged with water per XPO’s waste vendor requirements. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of paint (un1263) had been crushed and that 3 of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 2 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080881
item.description:
Report X-2023080881

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package reported leaking on load side. Upon inspection it was discovered the glass container of potassium hydroxide solution was shattered, causing the internal leakage. Further investigation revealed the package was sent on the overhead sorter. Package contained 2 different class 3 flammable liquid materials. DescribePack: The glass container of potassium hydroxide was shattered. Glass container of Toluene was undamaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA immediately responded to call for damaged hazmat, using appropriate materials and procedures to mitigate release.

item.title: Report E-2023090051
item.description:
Report E-2023090051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3260 was damaged by a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and a HEPA shop vacuum to collect the free standing product from the trailer floor The crew then utilized degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN3260-impacted material was collected and containerized in one 91) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fully regulated fiberboard box found on HMPA pallet within tote. Events prior unknown. DescribePack: One of one 2.5 gallon plastic jerrican lost 1.3 gallons from pinhole puncture to bottom of body (not on seam) from sharp protruding object during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned and ventilation was utilized.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking at the unload side. The package was put in hazardous bag and into a red tote. The red tote was delivered to QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: 2 of 4 1-gallon bottles had a loose causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was found leaking, it was placed in a hazardous bag and into a red tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fiberboard box found leaking in tote on HMPA pallet. Events prior unknown. Overpack label was noticed on outer box but when inner content was inspected, no UNPOP markings were found. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.2 gallon due a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a lined and lidded tote. PPE and ventilation was utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023080721
item.description:
Report X-2023080721

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was unloaded at door 21 at about 4:00AM on 08/04/2023. Upon being unloaded from the trailer, the package was covered with a black/purple stain. Absorbent pads were immediately used to contain the spill and a black tote was brought over from Quality Assurance upon notification. DescribePack: A 4.0 Liter bottle of Sysmex ColorWright Stain (UN1230) leaked out due to a loose cap on the plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To control the spill, absorbent pads were used immediately and Quality Assurance was called to assess the spill, in which a black tote was used to prevent any more leakage on the dock.

item.title: Report E-2023080785
item.description:
Report E-2023080785

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: Jackson
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, due to improper loading, a load shift occurred resulting in the release of 30 gallons of Spartan Shineline Emulsifier Plus, UN1760, from (6) 5-Gallon pails. The wooden trailer floor was impacted with product as well as asphalt outside of the trailer. HAZMAT contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup. A neutralizing agent was used during the remediation process.
